DB-9309 Reduce memory pressure when compacting on RSs

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't the permit be release if an exception was thrown and we are in the catch block?
timeline.author: arnaud-splice

replies.bodyText: That's a good point, I added some code to explicitly stop the Reading thread and unblock it if there's any exception here.
replies.author: dgomezferro

timeline.message: DB-9309 Handle failure cases more gracefully on compactions

timeline.bodyText: Why the buffer size is set to LocalCompactionResolutionBufferSize for precompact()? Should it be used for preFlush() instead?
timeline.author: jyuanca

replies.bodyText: This affects compactions that couldn't be run in Spark and fallback to run in HBase. I think flushes are fine because we are dealing with less data and the data itself is already in the MemStore, we are not bringing new data from a file into memory, so having a larger buffer shouldn't be a problem.
replies.author: dgomezferro
